## *COMING SUMMER 2026*

### **WHO**

Researchers, public health practitioners, data analysts, and anyone who uses county-level health data for research, policy, or community impact. Join our community if you care about transparent, reproducible, and accessible public health data.

### **WHAT**

A collaborative space where users can access validated code, methods, and inputs to calculate, update, and extend county-level measures of health and the conditions that shape health. Community members have access to:

-   [Documented workflows](https://github.com/County-Health-Rankings-and-Roadmaps/county_health_measure_calculations) for reproducible analysis
-   [Discussion Forum](https://github.com/County-Health-Rankings-and-Roadmaps/county_health_measure_calculations/discussions) for questions and troubleshooting
-   [Show and Tell space](https://github.com/County-Health-Rankings-and-Roadmaps/county_health_measure_calculations/discussions/categories/show-and-tell) to share successes, lessons, and analyses

We encourage public sharing, reuse, and adaptation of derivative data products and tools. Whether youâ€™re reproducing existing measures, refreshing them for new years, or building entirely new analyses, this community is a place to learn and build together. Check out the [Contribution Guidelines](https://county-health-rankings-and-roadmaps.github.io/welcome/contribute.html) to see how you can get involved.

### **WHEN**

The project is expected to be fully launched by Summer 2026, and the community will continue to grow and evolve as new health datasets become available.

### **WHERE**

All of our code, discussion forums, and resources live on [GitHub](https://github.com/County-Health-Rankings-and-Roadmaps). Anyone can access, use, and build upon them.

### **WHY**

CHR&R data-users have consistently expressed the importance of keeping these data accessible and usable for research, policy, and community decision-making. By making tools, code, and workflows open-source, we ensure county-level health data remain transparent, reproducible, and available for current and future public use. Our goal is to create a community that continues to independently calculate and update these measures when data become available in the absence of CHR&R.
